intro: Phacelia neomexicana var. coulteri, commonly known as Coulter's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. This species is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
